required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of TG103 Injection in Overweight/Obese Subjects Without Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multiple Dose Phase Ib Study in Overweight/Obese Subjects Without Diabetes to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Profile of TG103 Injection

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to assess the safety and tolerability of multiple doses of TG103 injection in overweight/obese subjects without diabetes

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, multiple-doses, parallel-group study to characterize the safety (including the anti-drug antibodies (ADA)), tolerability, pharmacokinetics (PK) and pharmacodynamics (PD) of TG103 injection. The study will consist of 3 periods: an approximately 4-week screening period, followed by a 12-week treatment period, and a 3-week safety follow-up period. Eligible subjects will be enrolled into three paralleled dose groups (15 mg, 22.5 mg and 30 mg) with 16 subjects in each group. Within each group, subjects will be randomized in a 3:1 ratio to receive TG103 injection or placebo subcutaneously (SC) once a week (QW) over a period of 12 weeks. Each group will be started at a low dose of 7.5 mg and gradually up-titrated at weekly intervals until the target dose.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability assessed by incidence and severity of adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: PK profile-AUC: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve
PK profile- Cmax: Peak Plasma Concentration
PK profile- Tmax: Time to maximum plasma concentration
PD profile- Weight change relative to baseline
PD profile- Proportion of subjects with a baseline weight loss of more than 5 percent
PD profile- Waistline change relative to baseline
PD profile- Change of waist-hip ratio relative to baseline
PD profile- Change of blood pressure（systolic blood pressure and diastolic blood pressure）relative to baseline
PD profile- Change of blood fat levels relative to baseline
The occurrence of TG103 anti-drug antibodies (ADA)

arm_group.description: TG103 injection (15 mg, N=12) and Placebo (N=4) will be administered subcutaneously once weekly in overweight/obese non-diabetic subjects.
TG103 injection (22.5 mg, N=12) and Placebo (N=4) will be administered subcutaneously once weekly in overweight/obese non-diabetic subjects.
TG103 injection (30 mg, N=12) and Placebo (N=4) will be administered subcutaneously once weekly in overweight/obese non-diabetic subjects.
